intro: Bunium macuca f. majus, commonly known as the greater fennel, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbrella-like clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is native to regions of Europe and western Asia. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along roadsides. Its aromatic properties make it a notable species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
